# resize(withOldSuperviewSize:)

**Instance Method**

Informs the view that the bounds size of its superview has changed.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func resize(withOldSuperviewSize oldSize: NSSize)
```

## Parameters

- **oldSize**: The previous size of the superview’s bounds rectangle.

## Discussion

This method is normally invoked automatically from [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/resizeSubviews(withOldSize:)].

The default implementation resizes the view according to the autoresizing options specified by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/autoresizingMask-swift.property] property. You shouldn’t invoke this method directly, but you can override it to define a specific resizing behavior.

If you override this method and call `super` as part of your implementation, you should be sure to call `super` before making changes to the receiving view’s frame yourself.

## Resizing Subviews

- **autoresizesSubviews**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view applies the autoresizing behavior to its subviews when its frame size changes.
- **autoresizingMask**: The options that determine how the view is resized relative to its superview.
- **NSView.AutoresizingMask**: Constants that specify the autoresizing behaviors for views.
- **resizeSubviews(withOldSize:)**: Informs the view’s subviews that the view’s bounds rectangle size has changed.
